title: Goat's headbutt frenzy causes thousands of dollars in damage | ABC NEWS
description: Shane Martin says a feral goat headbutted the glass door of his Cobar shop for about 20 minutes, leaving the door and three glass panels shattered.   Kristy DiGiacomo, a senior lecturer in production, animal nutrition and physiology at the University of Melbourne, said the goat's behaviour was all about scarce resources.   "Goats will headbutt for various reasons, including dominance, mating competition, defence, or just for play," Dr DiGiacomo said.   She said goats' "personalities" can change with the amount of resources available.   "Some [goats] are more likely to act aggressively when feeding, while others can be passive or avoiders," Dr DiGiacomo said.   "Aggressive behaviours tend to increase when access to feed is limited."   Mr Martin said the goat destroyed the glass front door of his office and two panels.   While he was yet to speak with his insurer, he estimated the damage bill at $4,000.   "[The goat] didn't manage to get inside, which was good," he said.   "Would have made a bit of a mess."  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: Aussie share market flat after small drop on Wall Street | Finance Report | ABC NEWS
description: The Australian share market opened higher and then eased after a Wall Street retreat from record highs. Donald Trump continued to hurl insults at US Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell, who is set to face a criminal investigation, while central bank chiefs across the world, including RBA governor Michele Bullock, issued a joint statement in support of Mr Powell. Alan Kohler explains. description: Adelaide United hopes it can go through mediation with former player Josh Cavallo who claims the club was homophobic and deliberately didn't play him in the A-League. title: Arrest of Kaz Hamad a major development in Melbourne tobacco wars | ABC NEWS
description: A major player allegedly behind Melbourne's fiery tobacco wars has been arrested in Iraq. Kazem Hamad was taken into custody after Iraqi authorities received a tip-off from the Australian Federal Police. It marks a major development in the government's fight against the tobacco black market, which has sparked scores of firebombings and at least two deaths. title: Clintons refuse to testify for US House Epstein investigation | ABC NEWS
description: Former US president Bill Clinton and former secretary of state Hillary Clinton say they will not comply with a US House subpoena issued for them to testify at an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. In a statement, the pair accused the Republican head of the US House Oversight Committee of overseeing a process "literally designed to result in our imprisonment". title: NSW premier appoints coordinators general to assist Bondi attack victims | ABC NEWS
description: One month on from the Bondi terror attack, the community continues to grapple with its fallout. NSW Premier Chris Minns has acknowledged the victims' families could be re-traumatised by the process of claiming compensation, and have difficulty navigating the scheme's bureaucracy. Two co-coordinators general have been appointed to provide support through the compensation process. Meanwhile, the future of the footbridge where two gunmen carried out the attack is being debated by the local community. title: Crane crashes onto passenger train in Thailand, killing dozens | The World | ABC News
description: At least 25 people have been killed and at least 80 injured after a construction crane fell on a passenger train in north-eastern Thailand, officials have said. The crane, which was being used to construct an elevated high-speed railway, fell on the moving train on Wednesday morning, local time, causing it to derail and catch fire. The accident occurred in the Sikhio district of Nakhon Ratchasima province, 230km north-east of Bangkok. It was travelling from the capital to Ubon Ratchathani province. Angus Mackintosh reports for The World.  #ABCTheWorld #ABCAsiaPacific  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. title: Iran massacre: Thousands killed as Trump promises "help is on its way" | The World | ABC News
description: The US President Donald Trump has warned Iran it will take very strong action it Tehran executes prisoners. Rights groups say at least 2,500 people have been killed following days of anti-government protests across Iran. But what will us intervention, if any, look like? The World's Girish Sawlani discussed the various scenarios with Benham Ben Taleblu, senior director of the Iran program at the Foundation for Defense of Democracies in Washington DC.
